text: But that day shall not wound mine eyes; the solide heape of night
Shall interpose, and stop mine eares, against thy plaints, and plight.
May I lie cold before that dreadful Day,
Press'd with a Load of Monumental Clay!
Thy Hector wrapt in everlasting Sleep,
Shall neither hear thee sigh, nor see thee weep.
But may I rest beneath my hill of earth
Or ere that day arrive! I would not live
To hear thy cries, and see thee torn away.
But may the heaped earth cover me dead, before I hear of this lamentation and abduction.
0, let the earth
Be heaped above my head in death before
I hear thy cries as thou art borne away!
But may this head beneath the sod be laid
Ere I a witness of thy sorrows be.
May I lie dead under the barrow that is heaped over my body ere I hear your cry as they carry you into bondage.
But let me be dead, and let the heaped-up earth cover me, ere I hear thy cries as they hale thee into captivity.
May I be dead and buried deep in the earth before I hear your cries and see you dragged away!
Ah, may the earth lie deep on my dead body before I hear the screams you utter as they drag you off!
But may I be dead and the piled earth hide me under before I
hear you crying and know by this that they drag you captive.
Let me be hidden dark down in my grave
before I hear your cry or know you captive!
But may I be dead and the heaped earth cover me, before I hear your screams and the sound of you being dragged away.
No, no
let the earth come piling over my dead body
before I hear your cries. I hear you dragged away!
But may I be dead
And the earth heaped up above me
Before I hear your cry as you are dragged away
May I lie dead,
hidden deep under a burial mound,
before I hear about your screaming,
as you are dragged away.
May I be dead, and the earth piled above me, before I hear your cries as they drag you away.
But may I be dead, with the cold earth piled up upon me,
before I can hear you wail as they drag you away.
But may the heaped earth cover me over dead
before I ever hear your cry as you are dragged away.
But as for me, I hope I will be dead,
and lying underneath a pile of earth,
so that I do not have to hear your screams
or watch when they are dragging you away.
